Operation 'get_/api/v1/nonprofits/list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary 'Search a nonprofit' is vague and singular-focused when the endpoint returns multiple results. Description lacks clarity on pagination parameters, expected input format, and response structure. Added specifics about filtering mechanism, pagination controls, return value structure, and use case context to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when to invoke this operation.

data.current_description: Retrieves a list of nonprofits whose names match the provided name. This endpoint is paginated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of nonprofits filtered by name. Accepts a name parameter for searching and pagination parameters (page, limit, or offset) to control result set size and position. Returns an array of nonprofit objects with their details. Useful for discovering nonprofits by name or browsing available nonprofits in the system.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Search a nonprofit' is vague and singular-focused when the endpoint returns multiple results. Description lacks clarity on pagination parameters, expected input format, and response structure. Added specifics about filtering mechanism, pagination controls, return value structure, and use case context to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand when to invoke this operation.

message: Operation 'post_/api/v1/donations/create' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (nonprofit ID, amount), expected output format, and specific side effects. Added details about authentication requirements, input parameters, billing/payout mechanics, and return value to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Creates a donation to any nonprofit. CHANGE keeps track of your donations, bills you at the end of the month, and handles the nonprofit payouts for you.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a donation to a specified nonprofit. Requires the nonprofit ID, donation amount, and authentication. CHANGE tracks the donation, aggregates billing for end-of-month processing, and manages nonprofit payouts automatically. Returns the created donation object with confirmation details and transaction ID.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on required inputs (nonprofit ID, amount), expected output format, and specific side effects. Added details about authentication requirements, input parameters, billing/payout mechanics, and return value to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/api/v1/donations/carbon_calculate' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description is verbose and unclear about expected outputs. Clarified required inputs (weight, method, distance), output format (USD amount, nonprofit ID), and the typical workflow (calculate then donate). Improved AI agent interpretability by explicitly stating what data is returned and how this operation fits into the donation workflow.

data.current_description: Calculates the donation amount (to CarbonFund 501\(c\)3) needed to offset a physical shipment. This calculation depends on the weight, primary transportation method, and distance of the shipment. Provide the distance of the shipment using the origin and destination address, or directly with the number of miles. For convenience, this endpoint also returns the id of the nonprofit CarbonFund, for making a subsequent donation to. See the [Carbon offsets guide](/recipes/carbon-offsets/) for more on using this endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Calculates the donation amount required to offset carbon emissions from a physical shipment to CarbonFund (501c3). Requires shipment weight, primary transportation method, and distance (provided as origin/destination addresses or direct mileage). Returns the calculated donation amount in USD and the CarbonFund nonprofit ID for subsequent donation creation. Use this endpoint before creating a donation to determine the appropriate offset amount.
data.reasoning: Description is verbose and unclear about expected outputs. Clarified required inputs (weight, method, distance), output format (USD amount, nonprofit ID), and the typical workflow (calculate then donate). Improved AI agent interpretability by explicitly stating what data is returned and how this operation fits into the donation workflow.

message: Operation 'get_/api/v1/donations/crypto_calculate' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks specificity about required inputs and output format. Added clarity on what cryptocurrency parameters are needed, the output format (USD amount, nonprofit ID), and the typical workflow. data.current_description: Calculates the donation amount (to CarbonFund 501\(c\)3) needed to offset a cryptocurrency transaction. For convenience, this endpoint also returns the id of the nonprofit CarbonFund, for making a subsequent donation to. See the [Carbon offsets guide](/recipes/carbon-offsets/) for more on using this endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Calculates the donation amount required to offset carbon emissions from a cryptocurrency transaction to CarbonFund (501c3). Requires cryptocurrency type and transaction amount/value. Returns the calculated donation amount in USD and the CarbonFund nonprofit ID for subsequent donation creation. Use this endpoint before creating a donation to determine the appropriate offset amount.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specificity about required inputs and output format. Added clarity on what cryptocurrency parameters are needed, the output format (USD amount, nonprofit ID), and the typical workflow. Improved AI agent understanding of when to use this operation and what to expect in return.

message: Operation 'get_/api/v1/donations/carbon_stats' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description explains the conditional behavior well but lacks clarity on what specific metrics are returned. Added examples of relatable impact metrics and clarified the output format. Improved AI agent understanding of what data will be returned and when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Measures your carbon offset impact in relatable terms. Provide the id of a donation to CarbonFund to see stats about that specific donation. If you omit the donation id, this endpoint returns aggregate stats for all of your CarbonFund donations.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves carbon offset impact statistics in relatable terms (e.g., trees planted equivalent, miles driven equivalent). Accepts an optional donation ID parameter: if provided, returns stats for that specific CarbonFund donation; if omitted, returns aggregate stats across all CarbonFund donations. Useful for displaying environmental impact to users.
data.reasoning: Description explains the conditional behavior well but lacks clarity on what specific metrics are returned. Added examples of relatable impact metrics and clarified the output format. Improved AI agent understanding of what data will be returned and when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get_/api/v1/nonprofits/show' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Original summary uses 'Show' which is less action-oriented than 'Retrieve'. Description is too vague about what information is returned. Added specific examples of returned fields and clarified the required input parameter. data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specified nonprofit including name, mission, tax status (501c3), contact information, and donation acceptance status. Requires the nonprofit ID as a parameter. Returns the nonprofit profile object with all available metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'Show' which is less action-oriented than 'Retrieve'. Description is too vague about what information is returned.
